thread.title: Alec Baldwin Back as Trump on 'SNL': "Prepare To Go To War" | Hollywood Reporter
thread.title_full: Alec Baldwin Back as Trump on 'SNL': "Prepare To Go To War" | Hollywood Reporter

author: Ryan Parker
title: Alec Baldwin Back as Trump on 'SNL': "Prepare To Go To War" | Hollywood Reporter
text:
Saturday Night Live Alec Baldwin as Donald Trump on 'SNL'. The main thread of the skit revolved around Steve Bannon, who was played by the grim reaper. 
Alec Baldwin was at it once more when he returned to this week's Saturday Night Live to once again give it to Donald Trump. 
Baldwin, who does an uncanny impression, skewed the president for another tough week after actual Trump got major pushback for newly enacted policies and butted heads with world leaders. 
Baldwin's Trump, wearing a Russian lapel flag, threatened Australia and Mexico with war over refugees and the wall, respectively. 
Baldwin also worked in the fictitious "Bowling Green massacre" and Trump's actual feud with new Apprentice host Arnold Schwarzenegger. 
The main thread of the skit revolved around Steve Bannon, who was played by the grim reaper, giving the Trump character awful advice, which of course he followed. 
Baldwin, who started doing the impression during the campaign season, has been very vocal in his criticisms of Trump and has said over social media numerous times he believes the former reality star is unfit for office. 
Trump on multiple occasions has taken the bait and blasted the sketch show — which he host in the past — and Baldwin, accusing the program and actor of essentially character assassination. 
Baldwin was even criticizing Trump hours before the show aired this week. 1-Trump is, quite simply, a man who was never embraced by his hometown, by NY society. Not even middle-of-road Repubs. Always peripheral.
